text:
Hello, I'm pretty new to HubSpot and a bit confused how to set up things properly.
Right now I'm building a website on HubSpot, it's some sort of a configurator. The user should put in some informations, based on that I make some suggestions and at the end I want the user to put in his email and a password and I want to create a contact out of it as well as some custom objects.
So I don't have a server or anything where I could run server-side code. I store all the informations the user had put in in JS variables and I want to push them to the HubSpot API.

My Question now is how would I do that properly, since I can't add PHP files to my HubSpot side I guess I would have to use some sort of serverless-functions, but I can't quite understand how those work.
My Pseudo-Code would look something like this:
`function createContact(data)`
`{`
    `//Call ServerLessFunction(data);`
`}`
So how would I call the serverless-function and how do I need to set that up?

Thanks in advance
Hello all - can someone show me how to pull associated company with a deal using the api? I don’t see it in my properties but it exists

I am calling <https://app.HubSpot.com/oauth/authorize?client_id={clientId}&redirect_uri={redirectUrl}&scope={string.Join(>" ", scope)}&state={state}  to get an authorization code.

I get the authorization code back in the redirect url @ code.

I send a GET to <https://api.hubapi.com/oauth/v1/access-tokens/{code}> and get the error:

`{`
  `"status": "error",`
  `"message": "The access token must have the correct format",`
  `"correlationId": "04b6d587-8dc4-4620-a0bb-2c19e7a0fc44"`
`}`
My code looks like a simple Guid that I get back from Hub Spot.
